title: Let‚Äôs explore the breathtaking world of distinctive marine species!!
text:
üîçBefore our exploration starts,how much do we truly know about them? Test your knowledge belowüëá

 

With the curious spirit,let the exploration begin!








Defination of marine species



Marine life, sea life, or ocean life is the plants, animals, and other organisms that live in the saltwater of seas oceans, or the salty water of coastal estuaries. At a fundamental level, marine life affects the nature of the planet.



This webpage mainly discuss about the peculiar and endangered species:

Peculiar Species:Endangered Species:


Beneath the waves of the Pacific Ocean lies the Clarion-Clipperton Zone, a vast expanse of mineral riches waiting to be explored. A recent analysis by the journal ‚ÄúCurrent Biology‚Äù estimates that this underwater realm is home to around 5,000 sea animals unknown to science. Astonishingly, scientists know more about the mysteries of space than the secrets hidden in the depths of our oceans. According to research from Dalhousie University in Nova Scotia, a staggering 91% of these marine animals remain undiscovered, underscoring the magnitude of the mysteries that still elude our understanding. The ocean, it seems, is a realm that rivals the enigma of the cosmos.‚Äù


Once seen as an infinite resource, the ocean now reveals a harsh truth ‚Äî many marine species are teetering on the edge of extinction. From the majestic whales to the playful dolphins, and the ancient sea turtles to the graceful seabirds, the populations of these creatures are dwindling at an alarming rate. ‚ÄòMore than 42,100 species are threatened with extinction, representing 28% of all assessed species,‚Äô warns the IUCN Red List. Among them, over 1,550 marine animals and plants are at risk, with climate change impacting 41% of threatened marine species. It‚Äôs a stark reality that demands our attention and action. As the numbers rise ‚Äî 150,388 species on the Red List, 42,108 facing extinction ‚Äî so does the urgency to protect our oceans and the incredible life they harbor. Let us stand together to ensure that these waters, once viewed as boundless, remain a thriving home for generations to come.(Marinebio,2023)

üí°After these explorations, do you have a clearer understanding now? Check it out hereüíÅÔºÅ

 



3. What is the overall count of marine species in a broder perspective?

After discovering these friends living beneath the surface, have you ever wondered about the broader perspective on the entire marine species?‚Äù






About this application



Play with the application below by adjusting the range of latitude and longitude on the 4 slider bars.This makes us delve into the investigation of the current conditions about the marine species counts.
This app is a representation of a dataset provided by the Aqua Map, which includes the computer-generated predictions of the natural distribution of marine species. These predictions are derived from the environmental preferences of each species, considering factors like depth, temperature,and their correlation with sea ice or coastal regions.This map primarily represents the marine species count within a distance of 50 km near the equator,a total of 33,512 species were used in the generation of this file.
These predictions are derived from the environmental preferences of each species, considering factors like depth, temperature,and their correlation with sea ice or coastal regions.This map primarily represents the marine species count within a distance of 50 km near the equator.

title: Marines Pollution
text:
Our ocean are burdened with an estimated 5.25 trillion pieces of plastic waste. 70% of our wastes sinks into the marine‚Äôs ecosystem,with 15% float and another 15% reaches our beaches.In the past 10 years, we‚Äôve made more plastic than the last century.


1. How much do you know about the pollution conditions of the oceans?Try it out!
 



2.The general conditions of marine pollutions:
(click on 2.1 and 2.2 to see different dataset)

2.1 Major marine waste by categories:2.2 Major waste per country:


This application is a representation of a dataset investigated by the SPREP ( the Pacific Regional Environment Programme) which shows the percentage of the majority of marine waste categories.






Some interesting interactions on this app:




Uncheck the boxes of the categories to hide what you do not want to explore.
Take picture by clicking on the camera icon at the top right of the graph.
Place mouse on the bar plot to see more detailed information about this category.



Among the categories,the polystyrene foam consititues the largest waste category, following closely behind are the ‚Äòplastics items‚Äô and ‚Äòplastic food packaging‚Äô, which are the 2nd and 3rd major marine wast categories.
 


This app showcases another set of data that is collected by the SPREP, which reveals the instances where different wastes are intentionally discarded from fishing vessels into various marine environment, the percentage of different types of the discharged waste are also shown in this graph.






Some interesting interaction on this app:




Choose different locations to see the what are the percentage of vrious types of wastes that is dumped in that area.



 
It is clearly seen on the graph that the major type of waste dumped in most of the fishing vessels are Plastics.This observation highlights a concerning trend in marine pollution, as plastics are known for their long-lasting environmental impact and potential harm to marine ecosystems.








3.Let us zoom in to see the plastic pollution conditions.

3.1
Firstly, let us explore the increasing trend of the plastic production globally over years.
This application represents a curated dataset presenting a historical growing trend of global plastic production spanning from 1950 to 2019. To estimate figures for the years 2016 to 2018, a consistent annual growth rate of 5% was applied, aligning with the growth projections presented by the researher.
 
3.2
Further more, let us take a look at the world‚Äôs plastic waste emitted to the ocean per capita in diferent countries, based on the stastistic produced the journal Science Advance.
According to the Guardian, there is likely to have three times more plastic waste emitted to the ocean in 2040. Click on the button to see the future prediction.
Zoom in on the map and invetigate the detailed pollution rate of each country.Click on the red or blue dots to get more information.

title: Dive into a captivating visual journey through the breathtaking world of distinctive marine species.
text:
Dive into a captivating visual journey through the breathtaking world of distinctive marine species. On this website page, you‚Äôll encounter a series of stunning photographs showcasing some of the ocean‚Äôs most extraordinary inhabitants. From the mesmerizing colors of the leafy sea dragon to the formidable strength of the mantis shrimp, our collection of images captures the sheer diversity and beauty that thrives beneath the waves.
Click on the Images for More Information: By clicking on each picture, you can access in-depth information about the featured marine species. Learn about their habits, habitats, unique characteristics, and the challenges they face in today‚Äôs changing world. Discover how these remarkable creatures contribute to the delicate balance of ocean ecosystems.
